timeline.body: This looks like a broken version of "CRS.lookupEpsgCode(crs, false)", in that it will fail if the CRS happens to have alternative authorities that are not "EPSG". Setting the second parameter to "false" avoids scans.

replies.bodyText: Whenever CRS you ask in output, the geometries in the catalog are stored into a unique CRS. So the query on the DB need to be made on that CRS even if the requested mosaic BBOX is using a different CRS. I'm going to clarify a bit this comment :)
replies.author: dromagnoli

timeline.body:
Magic number, best to make it a system variable if not a read parameter. 
I'd also suggest to switch the default to something larger, a classic world wide satellite mosaic case is having all UTM zones (60 zones, further split into south and north) and the two polar caps, making for 122 CRSs present at the same time in the mosaic.
